data.event: Located at the head of the Broadkill River, Milton was first settled in 1672 by English Colonists.

event.title: was known by various names until 1807

data.event: The town was known by various names until 1807, when it was named for the English poet, John Milton.

event.title: recognized the Town of Milton as a municipality in 1945

data.event: The Delaware General Assembly passed the charter that recognized the Town of Milton as a municipality in 1945.

event.title: were listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973

data.event: The Hazzard House, Hazzard House, and Gov. James Ponder House were listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973.
The Milton Historic District was added in 1982.
